fields.description:
In 4.1.0 with VPC mode, I was trying to run a new instance with a network interface specified during RunInstance , it failed to run on the Node controller with the following error message:

{code}
2015-01-16 03:10:44 ERROR 000013453 partition_creator        | [i-4ab91aec] failed to clone euca-zero device into partition: 12 blobstore.c:3535 failed to remove device mapper device with 'dmsetup'
{code}

The device mapper table on my node controller is:

{code}
# dmsetup table
euca-prt-08192ext3-8c587647: 0 16777216 linear 253:10 0
vg01-lv_swap: 0 16384000 linear 9:1 2048
vg01-lv_root: 0 417333248 linear 9:1 16386048
euca-prt-03072ext3-11384fdc-p0-snap: 0 6291456 snapshot 253:5 253:6 N 16
euca-prt-03072ext3-11384fdc: 0 6291456 linear 253:7 0
euca-prt-08192ext3-8c587647-p0-back: 0 16777216 linear 7:3 0
euca-prt-03072ext3-11384fdc-p0-back: 0 6291456 linear 7:2 0
euca-zero: 0 2199023255552 zero 
euca-prt-08192ext3-8c587647-p0-snap: 0 16777216 snapshot 253:5 253:9 N 16
{code}

This node controller was able to run instances earlier but not sure how suddenly today, device mapper started complaining like this.

Version of eucalyptus:

{code}
eucalyptus-4.1.0-0.0.22966.320.20150110git5285308.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-axis2c-common-4.1.0-0.0.22966.320.20150110git5285308.el6.x86_64
euca2ools-3.2.0-0.0.1640.14.20150108git94c0859.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-admin-tools-4.1.0-0.0.22966.320.20150110git5285308.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-blockdev-utils-4.1.0-0.0.22966.320.20150110git5285308.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-nc-4.1.0-0.0.22966.320.20150110git5285308.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-imaging-toolkit-4.1.0-0.0.22966.320.20150110git5285308.el6.x86_64
eucanetd-4.1.0-0.0.22966.320.20150110git5285308.el6.x86_64
{code}

Please let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers,
Deependra
fields.summary: failed to clone euca-zero device into partition dmsetup

2015-01-16 03:13:54  INFO 000028565 monitoring_thread        | [i-4ab91aec] forgetting about instance
{code}

I rebooted the node controller exhibiting the problem and now my device mapper table looks like:

{code}
# dmsetup table
vg01-lv_swap: 0 16384000 linear 9:1 2048
vg01-lv_root: 0 417333248 linear 9:1 16386048
{code}

It is clear that the node controller forgot to clean up artifacts that shouldn't have been there at the first place when no instances were running on it. Now I tried to create a new instance on this node controller and it works!

Please make sure NC is robust enough to handle such situations , we cannot afford to reboot systems to clean off device mapper table every time.

It appears that the error in EUCA-10214 is the same. The relevant log snippet (from the second nc.log file attached to that ticket) is:

{code}
2014-11-21 15:27:50 DEBUG 000114166 art_implement_tree       vbr.c:2969                        | [i-df8008fb] created a blob for an artifact 004|prt-399480ext3-d1701037 on try 1
2014-11-21 15:27:50 DEBUG 000114166 partition_creator        vbr.c:1145                        | [i-df8008fb] mapping euca-zero device into partition prt-399480ext3-d1701037
2014-11-21 15:27:50 TRACE 000114166 bs_errors                backing.c:206                     | blobstore: creating device euca-prt-399480ext3-d1701037-p0-back
2014-11-21 15:27:50 TRACE 000114166 bs_errors                backing.c:206                     | blobstore: error: blobstore.c:3679 failed to set up device mapper table with 'dmsetup'
2014-11-21 15:27:50 TRACE 000114166 bs_errors                backing.c:206                     | blobstore: 	/usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so(log_dump_trace+0x61) [0x7f2e94877b71]
	/usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so(+0x2385f8) [0x7f2e948495f8]
	/usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so(+0x23f58e) [0x7f2e9485058e]
	/usr/lib64/axis2c/services/EucalyptusNC/libEucalyptusNC.so(blockblob_clone+0x664) [0x7f2e94850f74]

In that case, the problem was apparently related to {{/var/lib/eucalyptus}} being a symbolic link. Is there anything unusual file system, [~dshekhawat], that is backing the files on your setup (i.e., are you using symbolic links anywhere, is the file system something other than ext2,3, or 4?) If not, we'll have to figure out how to reproduce this condition.
Its ext4 without any symbolic links for /var/lib/eucalyptus

[~dmitrii]  [~kedwards] The workaround for this issue is:
{code}
terminating all instances
removing any disk state with rm -rf /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances//
removing any kernel state by running three times: dmsetup table | grep euca | cut -d':' -f 1 | sort | uniq | xargs -L 1 dmsetup remove; losetup -a | cut -d':' -f 1 | xargs -L 1 losetup -d
restarting the NC service
{code}

The problem that the customer is having is that they cannot terminate their production instances to perform the workaround. They cannot migrate their instances because of corrupted/missing /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances files. Can you think of a way to clear the dmsetup table and regenerate the files in /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances without terminating existing instances?  The customer is seeing this on 4.0.2 without VPC.
Not seeing the above issue or any issue after migrating instance in VPCMIDO.
We're still unable to reproduce this in house.
